backend

Class UserManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • databaseConnectors.DatabaseManager
      • backend.UserManager

  • public class UserManager
extends DatabaseManager
    Class that is used to manage a user. It has functionality like deleting a user, finding users in the database and some other functions for logging in the right user.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserManager()

    • Method Detail

      • findUser

        public boolean findUser(java.lang.String username)
        Checks if the username exict in the database.
        Parameters:
        username - username of the user you want ot find.
        Returns:
        boolean true if successful, false if not.

      • findUsertype

        public int findUsertype(java.lang.String username)
        Finds the usertype (collector, analyst or admin) of a user.
        Parameters:
        username - username of the user you want to find the type of
        Returns:
        int

      • findUserByIndex

        public java.lang.String findUserByIndex(int i)
        Help method to findUserType(). Returns "Admin" if "i" is "0", "Analyst" if "i" is "1" and "Collector" if "i" is "2".
        Parameters:
        i - index that you get from the "findUserType(String username)" method.
        Returns:
        String the type of user

      • deleteUser

        public boolean deleteUser(java.lang.String username)
        Delete a user from the database. Returns true if successful, and false if the user does not exist or something went wrong while connecting to the database.
        Parameters:
        username - username of the user you want to delete.
        Returns:
        returns false if the user does not exist

      • registerUser

        public boolean registerUser(java.lang.String firstname,
                            java.lang.String lastname,
                            java.lang.String telephone,
                            java.lang.String username,
                            java.lang.String password,
                            java.lang.String usertype)
        Register a new user to the system and puts it in the database.
        Parameters:
        firstname - first name of the user you want to register.
        lastname - last name of the user you want to register.
        telephone - telephone number of the user you want to register.
        username - username of the user you want to register.
        password - password of the user you want to register.
        usertype - usertype of the user you want to register.
        Returns:
        boolean true if successful, false if not.

      • login

        public boolean login(java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String password)
        Checks if username exist and that the password is correct. Using two helping methods to do so. Returns true if ok.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user you want to check if exist.
        password - the password you want to check if correct.
        Returns:
        boolean true, username exist and password is correct, false if not.

      • checkPassword

        public boolean checkPassword(java.lang.String username,
                             java.lang.String password)
        Input password is being crypted with MD5 and compared with the crypted password saved in the dataBase. The actual password is never uncrypted, this is for safety reasons.
        Parameters:
        username - username of the user you want to check password for.
        password - password that you want to check.
        Returns:
        boolean true if correct password, false if wrong password or something went wrong when fetching from database.
